1.title: Mutt's Sauce
1.subtitle: In 1956, Mutt got the idea to make a sauce he could use for every meal. Mutt’s sauce was a multi-purpose specialty sauce, infusing sweet, tangy and a little bit of heat into each spoonful.

products.name: Combo 3 Pack
products.description: BEST VALUE! Try all three: Original, Sweet N Spicy, Ghost Pepper

products.name: Deluxe Spices 3 Pack
products.description: It took 7 years to decide on what flavors to introduce in our spice line. These spices are unique because when paired with Mutt's Sauce, you can create three limited edition flavors.

products.name: Deluxe Combo Pack — Sauce + Spices
products.description: This is the ultimate gift for Cooking with Mutt's Sauce!  Try the sauces:  Gluten Free Original, Sweet N Spicy, and Ghost Pepper, as well as our new line of spices: Berbere, Garlic Ghost Pepper, and Onion Pepper.

1.title: Racial Literacy: A Call to Action for Teachers
1.subtitle: Uprisings in the wake of George Floyd’s death at the hands of police and the worldwide reaction demanding racial justice represented a wake-up moment for schools. Talking about race will be essential if we are going to serve all students well.

2.title: Grace X Originals LLC
2.subtitle: Grace X Originals is a "Slow Fashion" Streetwear & Lifestyle Brand. We take our time to expertly hand-dye our textiles and apply high-end airbrush artistry to our designs with sustainable fashion practices foremost in mind.

2.title: StepStitches
2.subtitle: Welcome to StepStitches where you can find unique keepsakes sure to delight. Each item is handmade with love and exquisite care. Both ready to ship and custom made items are available.

products.name: Black Rag Doll - Raggedy Ann Doll
products.description: Cinnamon Annie® is a delightful vintage style doll with a modern twist. This Raggedy Ann style doll is dressed in a pretty floral navy and yellow dress with matching hair bow. Doll dress and hair bow are removable.

products.name: Raggedy Andy Doll - Boy Doll
products.description: Cinnamon Andrew is a fun vintage style doll with a modern twist. This Raggedy Andy style doll is dressed in light blue overalls with a white shirt and dark blue bow tie. Doll clothes are removable.

products.name: Personalized Raggedy Ann Doll
products.description: If you would like a name embroidered on the doll's dress, please choose that option AND write the name or phrase in the Note to Seller box during check-out.  She is Made to Order and will take approximately two weeks to complete before shipping.

3.title: NCMPRBL
3.subtitle: NCMPRBL (pronounced: N-Com-Par-Bull) is a black doctor owned watch and fashion accessories brand. Our premium watches and accessories are designed with 316L stainless steel, water resistance, and levels of attention meant to exceed your expectations.

3.title: When the first all-black professional basketball team dominated...back in the ’20s
3.subtitle: "They were literally pioneers and recognized that they were making a statement in front of the audiences."

4.title: So you want to talk about race
4.subtitle: Ijeoma Oluo guides readers of all races through subjects ranging from intersectionality and affirmative action to "model minorities" in an attempt to make the seemingly impossible possible: honest conversations about race and racism, and how they infect almost every aspect of American life.

4.title: The New Jim Crow
4.subtitle: The New Jim Crow is a stunning account of the rebirth of a caste-like system in the United States, one that has resulted in millions of African Americans locked behind bars and then relegated to a permanent second-class status—denied the very rights supposedly won in the Civil Rights Movement.

5.title: QuintesScential Candles
5.subtitle: Since we love burning scented candles, we decided to embark on our journey of becoming Black chandlers. We decided, from the beginning, to use only the healthiest ingredients in anything that we make and sell.

products.name: Earthy
products.description: Earthy is a sensual fragrance that lives up to its name. Our Earthy is aromatic, woodsy, and intoxicating, with a prominent sandalwood base, complemented by layers of sage, spice, and amber.

products.name: Sweet Dreams
products.description: Ready for bed? Time to unwind from a hectic day? Escape with gentle notes of lavender on your pillow with the crisp scent of freshly washed linen.

products.name: Pleasantry
products.description: Our Pleasantry is a proven pleaser, combining a patented odor neutralizing technology with a crisp, clean fragrance that brings to mind fresh linens drying on the line. Pleasantry doesn't just cover up unwanted smells, it cancels them out.

5.title: Carter G. Woodson - African American Trailblazers in Virginia History
5.subtitle: Enjoy a six-minute podcast on the life of Carter G. Woodson who helped start the first Negro History Week.

6.title: Mike D's BBQ
6.subtitle: Mike D's BBQ is an award winning line of signature BBQ sauces and all-purpose dry rubs. Our sauces are a twist on the traditional BBQ sauce with some unique seasonings and spice levels.

products.name: BIG Sauce Set
products.description: Mike D's BIG Sauce is our twist on a traditional BBQ Sauce. It has the perfect blend of smoky and sweet just like our rub. There is a small hint of heat to balance the flavors, but it is a very mild sauce overall.

products.name: Rub Master Set
products.description: Are you a master with the dry rub? This set allows you to use both award winning rubs on large and small meals like the master you are! This set contains one of each large rub (10.24 ounces)!

products.name: Throw Some D's On It T-Shirt
products.description: Rep your favorite BBQ brand and let everyone know they need to "Throw Some D's On It"

6.title: Inn8 Apparel
6.subtitle: Your mind. Your body. Your individuality. Your imperfections. These are the things you are born with. They are innate. Embrace them. They are yours. Celebrate them. They are yours. Love them. They are you.

products.name: "Beholder" Embroidered Unisex Hoodie
products.description: Embroidered hoodies are custom made to order and will take approximately 2-3 weeks to receive apparel.  Crafted for comfort, this lighter weight sweatshirt is perfect for relaxing. Once put on, it will be impossible to take off.

products.name: "Human" Unisex T-Shirt
products.description: This heavy cotton tee has the classic cotton look and feel. Casual elegance will make it an instant favorite in everyone's wardrobe.

products.name: "A Soul Lost in Time" Premium Matte Vertcial Posters
products.description: Every room deserves to be special. These supreme quality print posters in various sizes serve as statement pieces, creating a personalized environment.

7.title: Dr. Ernest Everett Just
7.subtitle: Dr. Ernest Just was a pioneering African American biologist, academic and science writer. Just's primary legacy is his recognition of the fundamental role of the cell surface in the development of organisms.

7.title: A.O. Hamer
7.subtitle:
Hey, I'm Aramis and I love color!

My acrylic paintings are inspired by divine femininity, music, higher consciousness, and the cosmos. Liberation is my life's work- to free myself from the chains that could hold me back mentally, physically, and spiritually. My paintbrush reminds me of the creative power I have within the canvas - and life. As I take this journey to freedom, I hope to inspire others along the way.

8.title: Justice for the Murder of Rayshard Brooks
8.subtitle: Rayshard Brooks, an unarmed, 27 year old Black man was murdered after 3 officers responded to complaints of him sleeping in his vehicle in the Wendy’s parking lot. After struggling with the officers, Brooks began to run for his life, when he was shot in the back more than once.

8.title: Tyre Nichols remembered as beautiful soul with creative eye
8.subtitle: On most weekends, Tyre Nichols would head to the city park, train his camera on the sky and wait for the sun to set. Learn more in this article from the Associated Press.

9.title: Oprah Winfrey's Cecil B. DeMille Award Acceptance Speech - 2018 Golden Globe Awards
9.subtitle: Watch Oprah Winfrey's 2018 Golden Globe Awards acceptance speech for the Cecil B. DeMille Award.

9.title: Implicit Bias — how it effects us and how we push through
9.subtitle: Everyone makes assumptions about people they don’t know. Melanie Funchess will teach us to recognize these assumptions and work toward a common understanding.

10.title: Microaggressions Matter
10.subtitle: They may not always be ill-intentioned, but the slights illuminate deeper problems in America.

10.title: The police who killed Tyre Nichols were Black. But they might still have been driven by racism
10.subtitle: CNN's Van Jones puts his thoughts to paper in this opinion piece in the role racism played in the killing of Tyre Nichols at the hands of 5 Black police officers in Memphis.

11.title: Princess Planet
11.subtitle: Princess Planet is a brand of children's entertainment that helps promote characters with diverse hair textures, skin tones, and cultural backgrounds.

products.name: An Octet of Odes – Volume 1
products.description: An Octet of Odes Volume One is a compilation of poems that premiers eight unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun. All of the princesses’ stories are rooted in the realities of geography and history. They all reflect a love of learning and an appreciation for language, diversity, and culture.

products.name: An Octet of Odes – Volume 2
products.description: An Octet of Odes Volume Two is a compilation of poems that premiers eight unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun.

products.name: Princess Planet: Coloring book
products.description: The Princess Planet Coloring Book showcases sixteen unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun. All of the princesses’ stories are rooted in the realities of geography and history. They all reflect a love of learning and an appreciation for language, diversity, and culture.

11.title: Code Switch Podcast
11.subtitle: Hosted by journalists of color, our podcast tackles the subject of race head-on. We explore how it impacts every part of society — from politics and pop culture to history, sports and everything in between. This podcast makes ALL OF US part of the conversation — because we're all part of the story.

12.title: African-American Heroism in the Military
12.subtitle: Dating all the way back to the American Revolution, African-Americans have played key roles in the history (and success) of the U.S. military. Profiled below are some notable African-Americans and their achievements, as well as milestones in the integration of African-Americans in the U.S. military.

12.title: The Legacy of Malcom X
12.subtitle: This podcast series about Malcom X El-Hajj Malik El-Shabazz brings together scholars from a variety of fields and is an invitation to connect our ideas, research projects, and activism across disciplinary divides.

13.title: How to Be an Antiracist
13.subtitle: Ibram X. Kendi's concept of antiracism reenergizes and reshapes the conversation about racial justice in America—but even more fundamentally, points us toward liberating new ways of thinking about ourselves and each other.

13.title: Mojo Jojo Pickles
13.subtitle: Mojo Jojo Pickles was started in 2011 as a commercial venture of a Slow Food Edmonton Canning Bee project Johwanna "Jojo" Alleyne started in 2010. Mojo Jojo Pickles has expanded to include many creative acidified and spirited preserved foods from pickles to condiments, beverage syrups, and shrubs.

products.name: Popular Pickle Pack
products.description: A collection of our most popular pickles: kim chi style brussels sprout, traditional pickled carrot, pickled snow pea, and lemon balsamic asparagus.

products.name: Brandied Saskatoon Berries
products.description: Whole Alberta Saskatoons in a cane sugar and whisky syrup.  Great for breakfast, desserts and cocktails.

products.name: Gingerbread Apple Butter
products.description: These fruit butters are made by slow-cooking fruit and cane sugar until it forms a thick creamy paste. We then add real vanilla and spice to enhance these flavours. Great on toast or pancakes but Divine with fine cheese.

14.title: Princess Omalie
14.subtitle: Welcome To The Wonderful World Of Princess Omalie Unlock the magic and lore of The kingdom of IgboOrai, Africa’s oldest Monarchy and greatest dynasty of kings and queens! We’ve been waiting for you!

products.name: Princess Omalie Doll – Gala Edition
products.description: Princess Omalie comes from a royal lineage of beautiful elegant women and embodies the kindness, confidence and excitement of young girls today. In this Gala Edition, she is exquisitely dressed and coiffed.

products.name: Princess Omalie Doll – Coronation Edition
products.description: Princess Omalie comes from a royal lineage of beautiful elegant women and embodies the kindness, confidence and excitement of young girls today. In this Coronation Edition, she is exquisitely dressed and coifed in a rich, soft cape and a smooth silky costume, designed by "Atelier de Babazongo" – dressmakers of the Royal family. As a treat, she holds a special key as your invitation to unlock the magic of her kingdom.

products.name: Princess Omalie, The Coronation And The Polka Dot Lamb
products.description: Princess Omalie of the African kingdom of IgboOrai could be the happiest girl on the planet — except that her family has been under a curse. Unless the curse of the Goliath beetle necklace is lifted, Omalie’s father might die in a horrible freak accident. He might never be crowned king. Omalie worries about her family, and about her own safety; how will she ever lead a peaceful happy life, have friends, and go to school?

14.title: How easy (or hard) is it to confuse a gun for a Taser?
14.subtitle: Oscar Grant. Eric Harris. Daunte Wright. April 11, 2020 added another name to the list of Black men killed by police officers who intended to deploy a Taser but instead fired a handgun.

15.title: What Is Juneteenth?
15.subtitle: Juneteenth (short for “June Nineteenth”) marks the day when federal troops arrived in Galveston, Texas in 1865 to take control of the state and ensure that all enslaved people be freed. The troops’ arrival came a full two and a half years after the signing of the Emancipation Proclamation. Juneteenth honors the end to slavery in the United States and is considered the longest-running African American holiday.

15.title: Change.org: Justice for Daunte Wright
15.subtitle: 20 year old man Daunte Wright, a father to a two year old, was murdered by Minneapolis-area police. Help get him and his family justice by signing this petition.

16.title: 22 Maps & Charts Explaining Mass Incarceration
16.subtitle: America is number one — in incarceration. Over the past several decades, the country has built the largest prison population in the entire world, with the second-highest prison population per capita behind the tiny African country of Seychelles. But how did it get this way?

16.title: Jackie Robinson's Effect on the Negro Leagues & MLB | 'Field of Dreams...Deferred'
16.subtitle: Things actually got tougher for Black baseball players after Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier, as MLB teams followed racist quotas and the Negro Leagues died out. "Many talented Black players got phased out."

17.title: The Uses of Anger: Women Responding to Racism
17.subtitle: In June 1981, Audre Lorde gave the keynote presentation at the National Women’s Studies Association Conference, Storrs, Connecticut. Her presentation appears here.

17.title: Brown Toy Box
17.subtitle: Our mission is to normalize Black excellence and create prosperous career pathways for Black children through STEAM education, cultural representation and educational play.

18.title: Esusu
18.subtitle: Forbes Under 30 social entrepreneurs, Nigerian-born entrepreneur Wemimo and his business partner Goel co-founded Esusu in 2019. The mobile platform helps individuals mostly from marginalized communities save money, access capital and build credit.

18.title: Ashay by the Bay
18.subtitle: We are an Independent Minority Owned Business and Deborah Day is the Founder and CEO. She opened the business in 2000 and started selling books online in 2002, establishing Ashay by the Bay as a Book Reseller that Specializes in African American and Multi-Cultural Children’s Books, Baby-3 and K-12 for Schools and Organizations.  We sell a Diverse Selection of books to both the Consumer and Business Markets and we Build Custom Collections for School and Classroom Libraries.  We also sell Gift Cards provide and we are the publishers of the Mindful Messages Curriculum.  Our home office is located in Vallejo, California. and we sell books throughout the US, Canada and select Markets around the world.

19.title: Whistling Vivaldi

22.title: Racially Targeted Arrests in the Era of Marijuana Reform
22.subtitle: For decades, marijuana laws have been used to criminalize Black and Brown people, waste taxpayer money, and fuel the mass incarceration crisis. However, states across the country are taking strides toward reforming these outdated and harmful policies.

22.title: Justice for Dominique Fells
22.subtitle: June 9th, another black trans woman named Dominique Fells was murdered and thrown in a river. The violence against black trans women needs to stop. We cannot allow for the murder of this young woman to go unpunished.

27.title: The symbols of systemic racism — and how to take away their power
27.subtitle: Multidisciplinary artist and TED Fellow Paul Rucker is unstitching the legacy of systemic racism in the United States. A collector of artifacts connected to the history of slavery — from branding irons and shackles to postcards depicting lynchings — Rucker couldn't find an undamaged Ku Klux Klan robe for his collection, so he began making his own.

28.title: VZN Clothing
28.subtitle: Our clothing is made to motivate you to visualize your goals and remain persistent through adversity. Vision is not simply seeing with the eyes, but rather creating a positive image and experience for your future success with your mind. By following your vision with action and remaining persistent through adversity, we believe anything is possible.

products.name: Spread Love, Not Germs Heart Mask

products.name: Memory Lane Poster Print

28.title: Reconstruction in America
28.subtitle: Read the Equal Justice Initiative's report on racial violence after the Civil War, from 1865-1876.

29.title: #ChooseToChallenge - International Women's Day
29.subtitle: A challenged world is an alert world. Individually, we're all responsible for our own thoughts and actions - all day, every day. We can all choose to challenge and call out gender bias and inequality. We can all choose to seek out and celebrate women's achievements. Collectively, we can all help create an inclusive world. From challenge comes change, so let's all choose to challenge.

29.title: Yelani

products.name: Moisture Blast Conditioning Shampoo
products.description: Infused with natural and top quality ingredients known for their moisturizing properties, our Moisture Blast Conditioning Shampoo gently hydrates, strengthens, deeply moisturizes and revitalizes dull and dry hair.

products.name: Herbal Beard Oil
products.description: Infused with a refreshing blend of all natural ingredients – grape seed, natural oils, essential fatty acids, jojoba and vitamin E – Yelani Men Beard Oil is essential for your beard needs.

products.name: Hand Sanitizer - Rosemary
products.description: Our 8 oz,  liquid hand sanitizer is easily applied with a fine mist spray. It contains 70% alcohol and ships from within the USA.

30.title: Seeing White Podcast Series
30.subtitle: Just what is going on with white people? Police shootings of unarmed African Americans. Acts of domestic terrorism by white supremacists. The renewed embrace of raw, undisguised white-identity politics. Unending racial inequity in schools, housing, criminal justice, and hiring. Some of this feels new, but in truth it’s an old story.

30.title: Hair: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
30.subtitle: John Oliver discusses the importance of Black hair, the ways it can be a target of discrimination, and some ideas to address that.

31.title: Me and White Supremacy
31.subtitle: Based on the viral Instagram challenge that captivated participants worldwide, Me and White Supremacy takes readers on a 28-day journey, complete with journal prompts, to do the necessary and vital work that can ultimately lead to improving race relations.

31.title: Does racism affect how you vote?
31.subtitle: Nate Silver has data that answers big questions about race in politics. For instance, in the 2008 presidential race, did Obama's skin color actually keep him from getting votes in some parts of the country? Stats and myths collide in this fascinating talk that ends with a remarkable insight.
